docs.lead_paragraph: BUSINESS DAY The Your Money column on Saturday, about health incentives in the workplace, referred imprecisely to a provision of the new federal health law. The law allows employers to offer rewards to employees of up to 30 percent of the total cost of health insurance (or up to 50 percent in some circumstances); 30 percent is not the minimum amount of rewards allowed.

docs.lead_paragraph: The incoming House majority leader, Representative Eric Cantor, Republican of Virginia, accused the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office on Wednesday of misrepresenting the cost of the recently enacted health care law at the behest of  Democrats in Congress.

headline.main: Cantor Says Budget Office Miscounted Health Costs

docs.abstract: Eric Cantor accuses the Congressional Budget Office of misrepresenting the cost of the new health care law at the behest of Democrats.
docs.snippet: Eric Cantor accuses the Congressional Budget Office of misrepresenting the cost of the new health care law at the behest of Democrats.

docs.lead_paragraph: Opposition to health-care rationing is a little like opposition to growing up. It sounds great. It's just not very practical.

headline.main: I'll Never Ration. Not Me. Not I.

docs.abstract: There is no choice but to ration health care. A commentary by Norman Ornstein offers yet another example. The choice is how to ration.
docs.snippet: There is no choice but to ration health care. A commentary by Norman Ornstein offers yet another example. The choice is how to ration.

keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Fourteen years ago, when I first wrote on the subject of egg donation for The New York Times Magazine, I visited a woman who was one of the first "brokers" in the country to match donors and prospective parents. We sat in her sunny California garden (all new things start in L.A.) and paged through books of donor profiles - complete with their health histories, lists of likes and dislikes and smiling photos of themselves and, often, their children.
docs.abstract: The magazine article's author responds to questions about surrogacy, egg donation and what makes a parent.
docs.snippet: The magazine article's author responds to questions about surrogacy, egg donation and what makes a parent.

docs.lead_paragraph: Public employees are much in the political bull's-eye these days, as governors, mayors and legislatures struggle beneath the burden of three years of declining tax revenues, all brought on by the Great Recession.
docs.abstract: A look at divergent views on a premise of many efforts to overhaul state and local finances: that government employees are overcompensated.
docs.snippet: A look at divergent views on a premise of many efforts to overhaul state and local finances: that government employees are overcompensated.

docs.lead_paragraph: Have President Obama's economic positions been more left-wing than his campaign suggested? Or more right-wing?

headline.main: Obama: More Left or Right Than Expected?

docs.abstract: Comparing President Obama with Candidate Obama and finding a lot of similarity.
docs.snippet: Comparing President Obama with Candidate Obama and finding a lot of similarity.
